articles.title: Personages of Different Countries Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Personages of Different Countries Visit DPRK Missions

					Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Organizations and personages of different countries visited the DPRK missions in their countries from Sept. 1 to 8 to congratulate the 63rd anniversary of the DPRK.   They included the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company, the administrations of Nakhodka City, Pokino City, Artyom City and Partizansk City, the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Maritime Territorial Branch of the "United Russia" Party, officials of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the "A Just Russia", the chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, the Central Council of the People's Democratic Party of Uzbekistan, personages of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Culture of Uzbekistan, the secretary of the Chamberlain of the Presidency of Egypt, the chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics, the vice-chairman of the Nepal-
					
					Korea Association of Men of Culture, the chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of Kimjongilism and the chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics.
					
					They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the full-length paintings of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and bowed in humble reverence.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Indian Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Indian Foreign Ministry Delegation

					Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with a delegation of the Ministry of the External Affairs of India led by its Secretary for East Asia Sanjay Singh, when it paid a courtesy call on him Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from New Nigerian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from New Nigerian Ambassador

					Pyongyang, September 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Maclean Igonikon Omuso, new Nigerian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday. 
					
					After receiving the credentials Kim Yong Nam had a talk with the ambassador.
